result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick R Flanagan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intimidate Victim/Dissuade Reporting [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.44(1).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Straight Time.
Apply 4 days sentence credit, if revoked.
Concurrent with: Count 3, if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.

Anger Management or Domestic Violence Counseling and follow through as deemed appropriate by Agent.
No violent contact with the victim listed in the Criminal Complaint.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

timeConds.notes:
Non-working hours (Huber) with all standard release conditions.
STAYED - to be used at Agent's discretion.

Straight Time.

Concurrent with: Count 2, if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Court costs are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Treatment Letter, received and filed in court.

Attorney Kristi J Gordon appeared for State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Patrick R Flanagan in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz. 

State moves to amend count 2 from a Felony to a Misdemeanor.
Defense has no objections.
Amended Information Filed.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to both counts 2 & 3.
Court finds the defendantn Guilty of both counts 2 & 3.
Count 1 is dismissed as a read in.
Victim presented a statement to the court.



Court orders the following:
Count 2:

Anger Management or DV Counseling and follow through as deemed appropriate by Agent.

No violent contact with:  victim listed in the criminal complaint.
DNA sample to be provided.

Costs:  $243
